content:
I missed this one in this mornings batch
http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/sdc/StructureDefinition-sdc-questionnaire-questionnaireAdaptive.html
(I don't think it makes sense to have a flag that can have multiple values...)
And yes it does support Uri too, though it's still worded as singular.
It does make sense because it's a boolean or a URL. Repeating the URL is completely appropriate.
Would you suggest that the boolean part wouldn't make sense to repeat, and just the URL side of things?
(I'm trying to work out what makes sense for the code generator)
Yes. Repeating the boolean doesn't make sense. Repeating it with distinct values would be a downright error. (In fact a boolean with any answer other than 'true' would be weird.)

Cool, so no change for this one.
But I'll need to do some thinking on what to do for extensions with multiple types in my generator.
